trans-unit.source: Represents white space between markup in a mixed content node or white space within an xml:space= 'preserve' scope.
This is also referred to as significant white space.
This class is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlSignificantWhitespace"></xref> class.
This constructor is called by derived class constructors to initialize state in this type.
The white space characters of the node.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.
Creates a duplicate of this node.
`CloneNode` serves as a copy constructor for nodes.
To see how this method behaves with other node types, see <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.CloneNode%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The cloned node has no parent.
<xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.ParentNode%2A> returns `null`.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to clone only the node itself.
For significant white space nodes, the cloned node always includes the data value, regardless of the parameter setting.
The cloned node.
Gets the local name of the node.

For <xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlSignificantWhitespace" name="XmlSignificantWhitespace" href=""></xref> nodes, this property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_#significant-whitespace" name="#significant-whitespace" href=""></xref>.
Gets the qualified name of the node.

For <xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlSignificantWhitespace" name="XmlSignificantWhitespace" href=""></xref> nodes, this property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_#significant-whitespace" name="#significant-whitespace" href=""></xref>.
Gets the type of the current node.
For <xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlSignificantWhitespace" name="XmlSignificantWhitespace" href=""></xref> nodes, this value is XmlNodeType.SignificantWhitespace.
Gets the parent of the current node.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNode"></xref> parent node of the current node.
Gets the text node that immediately precedes this node.
Returns <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNode"></xref>.
Gets or sets the value of the node.
When setting this property, valid white space characters must be specified.
White space can consist of one or more space characters, carriage returns, line feeds, or tabs.
The white space characters found in the node.
Setting <xref uid="langword_csharp_Value" name="Value" href=""></xref> to invalid white space characters.
Saves all the children of the node to the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.
This method is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).
The <xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlWriter" name="XmlWriter" href=""></xref> to which you want to save.
Saves the node to the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.
This method is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).
The <xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlWriter" name="XmlWriter" href=""></xref> to which you want to save.
